text: they're emptying the boats off Myanmar's
west coast but the traffickers haven't
given up on making some money
Halla da ira hinge a Muslim was ransomed
and freed last weekend after two and a
half months stuck on a boat that never
set out across the Andaman scene the
traffickers heard that their people in
Thailand were on the run and being
hunted by the police so they decided to
send this back to the brokers on the
land she took us to the spot where the
traffickers had brought her back on
shore so 3 nights ago
just by those coconut trees over there
just by the sea that's where Halladay
was brought on shore by the traffickers
with about 50 other people now who just
look across a hundred meters across to
the left there that building just there
is a police checkpoint hello hello my
lover we went to ask if the police have
seen anything we heard a trafficking
boats landed here on Sunday night if you
have any information about it they told
us they'd heard nothing that Sunday
night Halliday's mother was contacted
and immediately paid a ransom but her
close friend Sonora was not released
my friend is owned by another trafficker
from Malaysia so when we were brought
back onshore they asked for $300 for her
and when the money couldn't be found
they took her away I don't know where
they've taken her 9
we went to CSUN Noah's mother she told
me she was desperately looking for her
daughter and was so worried she was
finding it hard to eat do you want to go
to the police we can come with you to
the police how do you of course she said
this woman has just come back from being
trafficked and this woman's daughter is
still being held by the traffickers but
on land here and we've come here to ask
for your help
the police said they couldn't take the
reporters there was a VIP visit in town
and suggested the women come back on
another day today too busy with the
vice-president very much on their own
Brackins Muslim community is pulling
together on Saturday we watched as a
businessman trying to negotiate the
release of the husband of a reinjure
woman called Shafiq oh this week we went
back to find her so the traffickers were
asking for $200 per share figures
husband she was trying to borrow with
the money but the smile said it all
husband's come back he told me he was in
a clinic getting medical attention but
that he should be fine it was a small
piece of good news for a people
persecuted at home and exploited
wherever they go
June official BBC news in Alpine State
Myanmar
